file_content.text: Have my powers waned as I languished here?
I am your better. Pretend otherwise, your heart knows the truth.
Admit my superiority.
I'll never understand the pleasure your kind gets from rubbing it in.
Lord it over me. Fine. You are superior.
I've never faced a stronger foe.
You fought well.
Before you get any creative ideas, my friend, help me reseal Darth Ekkage in her cell.
Here's a better idea.
No. [Kill Ekkage]
All right.
Great. I'll fuse the locks and make sure she never gets out. We both achieve our goals.
I'm going to let her escape unless you destroy her in cold blood.
You kill her or she is free.
What? You can't be serious. Your mission would fail. Darth Baras would get his way.
I'm not afraid of Baras. I'll have my revenge on him no matter what he accomplishes for himself.
I don't care.
Are you willing to risk the consequences if you're wrong?
Maybe I'm bluffing.
It's the Jedi who care most that Darth Ekkage not be unleashed again.
You're putting me in a terrible position.
I will not kill the defenseless. And yet, if Ekkage escapes, she won't remain defenseless.
I'm trying to walk the light path, but my mandate is to kill her. If I fail, my status will be lost.
Save me from killing her.
You must kill her so that I remain in good standing and do not grow darker.
If you're walking the light, it's a great advantage to do it secretly from within the Empire.
Just as Nomen Karr did so many years ago to neutralize Ekkage in the first place.
It pains me, but I... I have to do it.
I feel... less than I was.
I enjoyed every painful moment.
So satisfying.
You are a very dangerous being.
I've never come so close to such pure evil.
It was for the best.
Had to be.
It was for your own good.
You'll thank me later.
Be a man and stop being so simpleminded.
Grow up.
The life of a Jedi is a difficult one, but that was the hardest choice I've faced.
I'll have to live with my decision.
That's little consolation.
You are now the dictator of my fate. What is to become of me?
Death is all that's left for you.
Nothingness. [Kill Ekkage.]
Regretfully, I cannot allow you to live.
Sorry, I have to kill you.
I will not beg.
Goodbye, Darth Ekkage.
My brother will avenge me--
I will reseal you in this cell so no one can ever free you again.
Continued incarceration.
Fine. After my brother smites you, he will come personally, and I doubt your efforts to seal me away will bar him.
So, lock me up. I will not resist.
Smart to leave her alive. Baras feeds off rage--her death would just make him stronger.
We are of like-mind, Captain.
Exactly my thinking.
I am not concerned about making Darth Baras stronger.
That is moot.
For Darth Ekkage, life in prison is worse than death.
I just want her to suffer.
Interesting decision. Not sure I get why you didn't kill her.
It's beyond you, Lieutenant.
Don't bother trying.
I feel unfulfilled. We had her, why not destroy her?
I will not have my decisions scrutinized.
Do not question me.
Your mercy is an inspiration. A weaker being would have killed her.
I'm glad you approve, Jaesa.
Thank you.
It may not have been the wisest choice, but in the end, it is right.
It was a difficult decision.
Her death would only fuel Darth Baras's rage and make him stronger.
I didn't do it to be merciful.
Now see, that's someone I would have figured you'd kill.
My reasons are beyond you, Vette.
You wouldn't understand.
Why? Why do we spare the kin of our sworn enemy?
Baras feeds off rage. Ekkage's death would only make him stronger.
It would strengthen my enemy.
Keep your nose out of my concerns, Talz.
None of your business.
For such a being, life in prison is worse than death.
Her suffering will continue.
Mull that over in death!
No mercy for you. [Kill her]
Baras will avenge me--
She was defeated, done. You shouldn't have killed her like that.
We could have locked her away again.
Now there is no chance of her escape. Admit it, this is the best option.
Death is more sure.
The logic is sound, but it still feels wrong.
Jedi nonsense. I will dispatch my enemies in whatever manner I choose.
Mercy is weak.
Then you're no better than Darth Baras.
I'll consider different tactics in the future.
Perhaps you're right.
I hope you'll come to see that to defy your former master, you have to walk a different path.
Now, what's to be between us? Do we part as friends or as enemies?
If I ever see you again, I will kill you.
Enemies.
That's pretty clear.
We fight the same foe. Perhaps when this war is over, we will talk.
Friends.
I'll look forward to the opportunity.
Good luck to you, Sith.
Was that wise, my lord, allowing the Jedi to live?
My decisions and orders are beyond you, Captain.
Don't question me.
Not sure why you let that Jedi walk out of here.
My decisions and orders are beyond you, Lieutenant.
Don't question me.
I'm pleased you parted with him on good terms.
How you feel about it is inconsequential.
I didn't do it for you.
It would benefit us in no way to destroy him.
It was the right thing.
Happy to please you, Jaesa.
I'm glad.
I can't imagine why we didn't kill him.
Hmm. You just let him go. Are you getting soft in your old age?
You're softening me up, Vette.
It's your influence.
There was a time I didn't need a reason to kill a Jedi. It seems that's changed.
Perhaps.
Please, save the commentary, Vette.
Just be quiet.
You of all beings should know better.
Is this soft? [Shock Vette]
Yow!
I'm warning you, I will not be ridiculed.
Mind your place.
We allow the enemy clan to live, why?
My actions and decisions are beyond you.
Don't question me.
We'll see if I come to regret it later.
Maybe not.
He earned my tolerance by being useful.
He helped me.
Let my lightsaber answer!
We do not part. [Attack]
I'm ready for you!
An incredible victory, my lord. This will make Servant One very pleased.
I wish I could see my old master's face when he hears the news.
It will make Baras furious.
This is but one battle in a larger war, Captain.
We have more to do.
There's only one being I'm trying to impress.
And the Emperor.
I wish we could see the look on Baras's face when he hears you've killed his sister.
You took the words out of my mouth, Lieutenant.
Exactly my sentiment.
This is but one battle in a larger war, Lieutenant.
There is more to do.
I would have done the same if she wasn't Baras's kin.
It wasn't personal.
We've destroyed a Darth--what an incredible rush!
She was beaten, defenseless. Was it really necessary to kill her?
A being that dark is never defenseless.
She was still a threat.
To preserve our status with the Hand, we must do what they expect.
A necessary evil.
Sometimes we must do what feels good.
No, but it was fun.
Wow, Darth Baras's sister. Funny, I didn't see a resemblance.
They'll be dead ringers when they're both decomposing.
Baras will look like her soon.
Keep your observations to yourself, Vette.
Quiet down.
That's the common trait; hideousness runs in that family.
Not true--they're both ugly.
This death fuels us! We have our greatest conquest!
Yes, it was grand.
Enjoy it.
There are much greater conquests ahead of us.
This is nothing.
You are merely window dressing, here. This is my victory.
We?
Now, we return to the ship and inform the Hand that the deed is done.
My lord, you are freed.
Rage! Wrath! Vengeance! I've been dormant too long. I need outlets!
Had my brother sent anyone else, I would destroy them for practice.
Go ahead--kill him.
Do it.
Not much of a thank you.
Call that gratitude?
[Remain hidden]
Why did it take Baras so long to discover Belsavis? He must be getting weak.
Baras has ascended to the Dark Council and with your help, will soon be named the Voice of the Emperor.
That will never come to pass.
Not going to happen.
Time to put an end to this reunion.
I've heard enough.
[Remain hidden]
If he has everything under control, tell me why my assassins are dead.
If my dear brother has everything under control, then where are my assassins?
I sent my commandos to release them. What do you sense?
I sense their deaths. Someone has wiped them out. Every last one.
I was afraid I might have missed one or two.
I hope that's true.
Before you arrived here, I sensed my assassins being freed, and then someone turned their hearts against me.
That someone is me.
I'm the one.
Your assassins were all too happy to turn their back on you.
It was easy.
Melicoste, you incompetent! You've been followed. Prove your worth as we deal with this intruder, or I will kill you after all.
Kill him now. He'll only get in your way. Better if we tangle without the distraction.
Why wait?
How right you are, whoever you are.
You've done what your master bade--Ekkage is out of her cell. This isn't your fight. I'll cover you, just leave.
Save yourself, Melicoste.
I should kill you simply for being Baras's stooge. Melicoste, you have one chance to live--get out of here, now.
Leave or die, errand boy.
It's you--I thought Darth Baras destroyed you.
My loyalty stops just shy of forfeiting my life. If I die either way, that's my cue to leave.
Go. You're not worthy of the effort. It would seem this intruder is, however.
[Remain hidden]
I don't know what to say, my lord. I've taken every precaution.
You've grown incompetent in your old age. I believe I will vent my frustrations after all!
Yaaahh!
I will tell your master, my brother, the future Voice of the Emperor, that you died like a dog.
I'm not going to let you deliver that message.
You'll never see Baras again.
You are truly Baras's kin. To betray someone so loyal to you.
Like brother, like sister.
It is a family tradition.
Well done. A virtuoso performance!
Bravo!
Wait until you see the encore.
Now, exactly who are you?
He's with me, Ekkage.
She's with me, Ekkage.
Nomen Karr's sad little whelp. This just gets better and better.
If you're aligned with this Jedi, you are a fool and a traitor.
I am the Emperor's Wrath, unleashed by his Hand, and the Emperor has marked you and your brother as enemies.
You and Baras are traitors.
So the Emperor's Hand now works with the Jedi? No wonder my brother defies the Emperor.
Call me what you will, it doesn't change anything.
Sticks and stones.
A Sith who finds himself working toward the same goal as a Jedi should realize something is wrong.
Don't worry, he returns to enemy status as soon as you are defeated.
Only a temporary alliance.
I like that you've used this Jedi, primarily because it gives me the chance to end him.
I just destroyed a lord with a mere flick of my wrist. Don't blink, I'm about to do it again!
You and I are on opposite sides of destiny. So, I'm just going to kill you now.
We fight together, Sith!
I'm the one who's going to destroy Darth Baras and everything he wants. Including you.
I am doom.
I am the Emperor's Wrath, and you and your brother are enemies of the Emperor.
I do the Emperor's bidding.
I'm here to make sure you stay locked up.
Your new warden.
I don't care if you were strong enough to deal with my assassins.
Baras will be declared the Voice of the Emperor, then he and I shall dominate the Empire. I'm not going to miss that.
